node.title: Nations reach climate deal at COP26 after compromise on coal
node.alt: A man wearing a face mask walks past a banner reading 'together for our planet'
node.description: Government negotiators from nearly 200 countries have adopted a new deal on climate action after a last-minute intervention by India to water down the language on cutting emissions from coal.
node.content: ["Government negotiators from nearly 200 countries have adopted a new deal on climate action after a last-minute intervention by India to water down the language on cutting emissions from coal.", "The agreement, which came more than 24 hours after Friday afternoon's deadline, was sealed by COP26 president Alok Sharma banging down his gavel to signal there were no objections from the 197 nations attending the conference.\u00a0", "Earlier, Mr Sharma broke\u00a0down during proceedings and apologised after objections by India over the wording around the phasing out of fossil fuels forced a last-minute change to the text, drawing complaints from vulnerable nations wanting stronger action on fossil fuels.\u00a0", "His voice breaking with emotion after hearing from nations which expressed their anger over the changes to the text, he said: \"May I just say to all delegates, I apologise for the way this process has unfolded and I am deeply sorry.\"\u00a0", "\"I also understand the deep disappointment, but I think as you have noted, it's also vital that we protect this package.\"\u00a0", "More to come."]
